alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 5:30AM EDT until July 29 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Belmont County in east central Ohio... Northeastern Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Southern Harrison County in east central Ohio... Southeastern Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... * Until 830 AM EDT. * At 530 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cadiz, Freeport, Antrim, Flushing, Holloway, New Athens, Piedmont, Tippecanoe, Stillwater, Gilmore, Fairview, Deersville, Birmingham, Clendening Lake, Piedmont Lake, Tappan Lake and Salt Fork State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
